intro: Centaurea achtarovii subsp. sooana, commonly known as the Sooana knapweed, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a compact, bushy growth form. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while the flowers are typically pink to purple in color. It is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
